verses.plain: The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the LORD is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?

tokens.t: The
my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the
the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?

verses.plain: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.

tokens.t: When the wicked,
mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.

verses.plain: Though an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear: though war should rise against me, in this will I be confident.

tokens.t: Though an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear: though war should rise against me, in this
I
confident.

verses.plain: One thing have I desired of the LORD, that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the LORD, and to enquire in his temple.

tokens.t: One
have I desired of the
, that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the
all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the
, and to enquire in his temple.

verses.plain: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon a rock.

tokens.t: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon a rock.

verses.plain: And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the LORD.

tokens.t: And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the

verses.plain: Hear, O LORD, when I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.

tokens.t: Hear, O
I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.

verses.plain: When thou saidst, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, LORD, will I seek.

tokens.t: , Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face,
, will I seek.

verses.plain: Hide not thy face far from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.

tokens.t: Hide not thy face
from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.

verses.plain: When my father and my mother forsake me, then the LORD will take me up.

tokens.t: When my father and my mother forsake me, then the
will take me up.

verses.plain: Teach me thy way, O LORD, and lead me in a plain path, because of mine enemies.

tokens.t: Teach me thy way, O
, and lead me in a plain path, because of mine enemies.

verses.plain: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for false witnesses are risen up against me, and such as breathe out cruelty.

tokens.t: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for false witnesses are risen up against me, and such as breathe out cruelty.

verses.plain: I had fainted, unless I had believed to see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.

tokens.t: , unless I had believed to see the goodness of the
in the land of the living.

verses.plain: Wait on the LORD: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the LORD.

tokens.t: Wait on the
: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the

footnotes.text: When…: or, My heart said unto thee, Let my face seek thy face, etc
a plain…: Heb. a way of plainness
mine…: Heb. those which observe me
